result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp appeared by phone.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion to Suppress Evidence Illegally Seized
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA James Sempf.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Called @ 3:16 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for first status on 22CF252 and 22CF225, and 2nd status on 22CF32. Record by Atty. Pruden who has just received an offer and needs to go over it with the defendant. Response by the Court that matters are already assigned to Judge Koss and sets all matters on his calendar after August 1, 2022. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Defendant advised of right to and waived preliminary hearing. Court ordered defendant bound over. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Larry Pruden. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Larry Pruden appeared. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Pruden, argument, state objects to modification. Denied. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Order Vacating Judgment on Bail Forfeiture

ADDRESS INFO for Ashley N Hafferkamp
Current: 10217 195th Ave, Bristol, WI 53104 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2022)
Prior: 10217 195th Ave, Bristol, WI 53104
Proposed Order Vacating Judgment on Bail Forfeiture
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

MUST COMPLY WITH PRE TRIAL SERVICES
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.   Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH J.G.M (dob 5/3/1957) OR HIS RESIDENCE.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR LUIS CRUZ.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Pruden. Granted. Vacate prior judgment of bail forfeiture. Reinstate prior bond. Attorney Pruden provided proof of Defendant's incarceration in Kenosha County. Information will mirror complaint. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Attorney Pruden states defendant was in custody. Court needs verification of dates she was in custody. Minutes filed.
Verification of Incarceration in Kenosha Detention Center
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.
See signature bond for conditions

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Larry Pruden
